t.ed:del: Marks a block of a template as being a comment, which will not result in any output. The tag is primarly used to supply templates with comments for developers and theme designers. Anything inside the xar:comment block will be ignored.
t.ed:ins: This tag is used to produce a comment in the output stream. For (X)HTML this would mean <!-- something -->

section.title: Forms
section.t: Only to be used in open form

t.t: Internet Explorer conditional comment support. IE has a feature where you can test for certain (limited) conditions inside a specially formatted html comment. Other browsers will just see the output as a comment, but IE will react to the special format based on the truth value of the condition.

ed:issue.name: reversal of comment semantics
ed:issue.ed:item: BL has the semantics of xar:comment vs. <-- comments reversed.
Conditional comments or other comment production into output is impossible
ed:issue.ed:resolution: We let xar:comment produce a comment in the output stream now while <-- comments are ignored by the parser

ed:del.artwork: <xar:comment> The contents of the comment tag will be ignored completely </xar:comment>

ed:ins.artwork:
<xar:comment> The contents of the comment tag will be put inside a comment in the output format. </xar:comment>
The above will produce: <!-- The contents of the comment tag will be put inside a comment in the output format. -->
